page.title: 06Mr. Broome - A Bee-Keeper
page.content:
{Bees}have been kept in{Preston Brook for about eighty-five years.
Mrs. Broomes' grandfather (Mr. P.J. Webb) first kept bees at Canal House about 200 yards from the Broomes' present home. Their son took over in 1964 and he has continued the tradition ever since.
There are five hives in the garden of the cottage, which was formerly the {Post Office and Telegraph Office}close to the Roman Road.
Mr. Broome has acquired a detailed knowledge of bees and gives lectures on them to various groups like the Women's Institutes.
